original_title: Sri Lanka sells Rs55.4bn in T-bill auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has sold only 55.4 billion rupees of Treasury bills at an auction on Wednesday, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office sold 15.6 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 23.00 percent, unchanged from a week earlier, after offering 60 billion rupees.
Only 19 billion rupees of 6-month bills were sold at 19.49 percent, unchanged from a week earlier, after offering 35 billion rupees.
20 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 16.99 percent, unchanged from a week earlier, after offering 35 billion rupees. (Colombo/June/27/2022)
